official-title.#text:
To include reasonable costs for high-speed Internet service in the utility allowances for families
			 residing in public housing, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Closing the Digital Divide for Students Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Closing the Digital Divide for Students Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subsection (b) of section 3 of the United States Housing Act of 1937

header.#text: Inclusion of high-speed Internet service in public housing utility allowances for certain families

text.#text:
A utility allowance under this Act for public housing shall include costs for high-speed Internet
			 service, subject to the following limitations:

exceed the lowest cost available in the area of such housing for such high-speed Internet service;
			 and

include any costs for cable or satellite television service or for joint packages for Internet
			 service together with cable or satellite television service.

The cost included in a utility allowance for a public housing dwelling unit pursuant to this
			 paragraph shall not—

Costs for high-speed Internet service may be included in a utility allowance only for a household
			 that incurs such costs and includes children who qualify for free and
			 reduced price lunch pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 9 of the Richard B. Russell
			 National School Lunch Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act/s:9

text.#text:
Costs for high-speed Internet service may be included in a utility allowance for a household only
			 if the Internet service provider, upon initial provision of such service
			 for a household, provides the household with a specific technology capable
			 of blocking or filtering Internet access to visual depictions described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that provides a level of protection against access by
			 minors to such depictions through the Internet that is at least as great
			 as the level of protection provided by a technology protection measure (as
			 such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 254(h)(5)(B)(i) of the Communications Act of 1937

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5834 IH: Closing the Digital Divide for Students Act of 2014
